member.summary: Fills an array with the given value

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.BlitUtils.LoadString(System.Char*,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given string to the given pointer
member.param: A pointer to an array of characters
The string to write into the given pointer (ensure the destination pointer is big enough!)

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.BlitUtils.CopyB64(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Copies 'length' number of bytes, from the given source, to the given destination
This initially copies in blocks of 64 bytes, then blocks of 16, then the remaining bytes (less than 16) are copied individually
member.param: Source of the bytes to copy from
Destination of the bytes to paste into
The number of bytes to copy from src to dest

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.BlitUtils.CopyB256(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Copies 'length' number of bytes, from the given source, to the given destination. This method is intended for copying very large amounts of data, in the 1000s of bytes, for the reason below
This initially copies in blocks of 256 bytes, then blocks of 64, then blocks of 16, then the remaining bytes (less than 16) are copied individually
member.param: Source of the bytes to copy from
Destination of the bytes to paste into
The number of bytes to copy from src to dest

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.CollectionUtils.IsEmpty``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary:
A linq-based function, that checks if the given enumerable source is empty
It may not check every single element, because it will return false once any element satisfies the given predicate
This is equivalent to source.Any(predicate), but i keep forgetting that method name, and i'm more used to java's isEmpty() method
member.exception: Thrown if the given enumerable source, or the predicate, are null

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.ObjectUtils.CopyObj``1(``0)
member.summary: Copies the given blittable type
member.param: The value to copy
member.returns: A unique deep-clone (all bytes copied) of the given value

member.name: T:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils
member.summary: Helper methods for strings

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.JSubstring(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Java's substring, where you provide a start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) index
member.param: The value to substring from
Index of the first character to substring (inclusive)
Index after the last character to substring (therefore, exclusive)

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.JSubstring(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Java's substring method. Simply calls value.Substring(startIndex)

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.Repeat(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Repeats the given string the given number of times, and returns a string of the repeated given string
member.param: The string to repeat
The number of times to repeat (and therefore the length of the return string, multiplied by the length of the given string)

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.Repeat(System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary: Repeats the given character the given number of times, and returns a string of the repeated characters
member.param: The character to repeat
The number of times to repeat (and therefore the length of the return string)

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.Extract(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Extracts a string between and at the given start and end index
Equivalent to value.Substring(start, end - start - 1)
member.param: The value to substring from
First index in the string to extract from (inclusive)
Last index in the string to extract from (inclusive)

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.After(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the remaining characters after the given value
member.param: The string
The value (exclusive)
The index to start searching at. 0 by default
member.returns: Null if this string doesn't contain the given value(at or past the given start index). Otherwise it returns the remaining characters after the given value

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.Before(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the characters leading up to the given value
member.param: The string
The value (exclusive)
The index to start searching at. 0 by default
member.returns: Null if this string doesn't contain the given value (at or past the given start index). Otherwise it returns the characters leading up to the given value

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.StringUtils.Between(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the characters between the first occourance of the given 2 values; a and b
member.param: The string
Between this... (exclusive)
and this (exclusive)
The index to start searching at. 0 by default
member.returns: Null if this string doesn't contain a or b (at or past the given start index)

member.name: F:REghZy.Utils.Time.TICK_PER_SECOND
member.summary:
This specifies how many ticks there are in 1 second. This usually never changes during the app's runtime. Though, it might change for different operating systems
If one were to call , then for 1000ms, then , the interval will roughly equal to this field's value

member.name: F:REghZy.Utils.Time.TICK_PER_MILLIS
member.summary:
A multiplier for converting ticks to milliseconds
If one were to call , then for 1000ms, then , the interval will roughly equal to 1,000

member.name: F:REghZy.Utils.Time.TICK_PER_NANOS
member.summary:
A multiplier for converting ticks to milliseconds
If one were to call , then for 1000ms, then , the interval will roughly equal to 1,000,000

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.Time.GetSystemTicks
member.summary: Gets the system's performance counter ticks

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.Time.GetSystemNanos
member.summary: Gets the system's performance counter ticks and converts them to nanoseconds

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.Time.GetSystemMillis
member.summary: Gets the system's performance counter ticks and converts them to milliseconds

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.Time.GetSystemSeconds
member.summary: Gets the system's performance counter ticks and converts them to seconds

member.name: M:REghZy.Utils.Time.GetSystemSecondsD
member.summary: Gets the system's performance counter ticks and converts them to decimal seconds
